DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study develop effective way help patient caregiver cope cancer pain . The investigator look usefulness Caregiver-Guided Pain Management Training Intervention versus Pain Education .
DOC.brief_title: Caregiver-Guided Pain Management Training Palliative Care
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim study test efficacy Caregiver-Guided Pain Management Training intervention improve caregiver 's self-efficacy help patient manage pain . Secondary aim include test effectiveness CG-PMT intervention improve patient pain severity , patient self-efficacy pain management patient psychological distress , well short-term caregiver adjustment caregiver adjustment follow patient 's death . In multi-site study , 236 dyad ( patient cancer pain family caregiver ) randomize either Caregiver-Guided Pain Management Training protocol Enhanced Treatment-as-Usual control condition . Dyads Caregiver-Guided Pain Management condition receive three one-hour session conduct via videoconference . Dyads Enhanced Treatment-as-Usual condition receive educational material cancer pain management receive study-related treatment session . Assessments conduct patient caregiver treatment , caregiver 4 month 11 month follow patient 's death . The primary hypothesis test caregiver receive intervention report significantly high level self-efficacy help patient manage pain caregiver control condition . Secondary aim focus ( ) improvements short-term caregiver adjustment well caregiver adjustment follow patient 's death , ( b ) patient pain severity , self-efficacy pain management , psychological distress .
